Back to Johannes Brahms

Johannes Brahms

Hungarian Dances, WoO 1

c. 1868

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP]

Total duration: 25' 30"

  • 1. G minor
  • 2. D minor
  • 3. F major
  • 4. F-sharp minor
  • 5. F-sharp minor
  • 6. D-flat major
  • 7. F major
  • 8. A minor
  • 9. E minor
  • 10. E major

These ten dances were originally written in two different versions: one for piano duet and one for solo piano. Brahms later made orchestrations of nos. 1, 3 and 10. Around 1880, Brahms wrote a further eleven dances for piano duet, but without versions for solo piano.

Recommended editions

  • Neue-Brahms Ausgabe (Henle) · III/7 · HN 6009 · Klavierwerke ohne Opuszahl · ed. Camilla Cai
  • Henle · HN 560 · ed. Camilla Cai
  • Könemann · K 116 · Scherzo, Balladen, Rhapsodien und Tänze · ed. Enikő Gyenge
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50180 · ed. Ernst Herttrich

1. G minor

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 4

2. D minor

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 4

3. F major

Duration: 2' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

4. F-sharp minor

The version for piano duet is in F minor.

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 4.5

Duration: 2'

Difficulty: 4

6. D-flat major

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 4.5

7. F major

The version for piano duet is in A major.

Duration: 1' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

8. A minor

Duration: 2' 30"

Difficulty: 4.5

9. E minor

Duration: 2'

Difficulty: 4

10. E major

The version for orchestra is in F major.

Duration: 2'

Difficulty: 4.5
